## About this guide

This guide offers a suggested reading order for those who wish to study Mathematics in a structured way. It brings together the main content available in the section, organizing courses, articles, and reflections into a coherent path — from introduction to advanced topics.

## ✅ Suggested order

1. **[📘 🧮 Why is \(0! = 1\)?](zero-factorial.qmd)** — Start with this post to explore the mathematical consistency of the factorial definition.
2. **[📘 🧮 Beauty is the First Test](mathematical-beauty.qmd)** — An inspiring read to appreciate mathematics as a form of art.
3. **[📘 ✨ 🧮 ⚛️ Equations that Shaped History](historical-equations.qmd)** — A selection of beautiful and influential equations in mathematics and physics, with accessible explanations and visualizations.
4. **[🎓 🧮 Differential and Integral Calculus Course](../courses/mathematics/calculus/index.qmd)** — Next, navigate through the course index.

📌 This guide is updated as new content is published.
